intro: Leandra variabilis, commonly known as the variable leandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture, while its flowers range in color from white to pink and yellow. Leandra variabilis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
